content: easy garter stitch mitts a beginner-friendly knit by kelly meneely ________________________________________________ introduction years ago i wanted to teach a room full of people how to knit but i had limited time and resources to teach such a large group i also wanted it to be a fun experience of knitting something more exciting than a dishcloth and faster than a scarf these mitts are designed to be knit side to side and then seamed using the cast on and bind off tails leaving a gap for the thumb hole they are very customizable and functional pattern information yarn - use any yarn you like from dk-chunky/bulky weight i recommend 50g worsted weight for your first pair needles - straight or circular needles in us 6 or 7 if using worsted weight yarn you will want to adjust needle sizes if using thinner or thicker yarn notions - darning/yarn needle scissors gauge - unlike most knitting patterns the gauge here is not crucial after knitting a few row measure the length of your hand to determine if the mitten will be long enough for your tastes sizing - one size adjustable feel free to cast on more or fewer stitches for a custom length mitt the example is 7 5 long © 2011 2022 easy garter stitch mitts by kelly meneely the caffeinated ewe designs 1 techniques used - casting on your choice of method knit stitch binding off knitwise if any of these techniques are new to you i recommend youtube or your lys for a plethora of amazing video tutorials pattern instructions set up cast on co 26 stitches loosely leaving a long tail at least 8 for seaming your mitts at the end knitting the mitt knit every row until the piece measures at least 5 unstretched stretch the piece around your hand to determine if the piece is long enough it will look like a rectangle end your last knit row such that your co tail and your working yarn are on the same side of your work bind off & finishing bind off bobble loosely cut yarn with a long tail at least 8 and pull the yarn tail through the remaining stitch using the two long tails and a tapestry or large sewing needle fold the rectangle lengthwise garter ridges should be parallel to your fingers as in the photo above and sew up each end leaving at least a 1 5 hole for your thumb see photo note the mittens shown above are 7 5 long with 2 sewn at the top a 1 5 opening for the thumb in the middle and 4 sewn at the bottom knot the ends in an inconspicuous place weave in loose ends and trim the remaining ends repeat all steps for the second mitt wet block if desired * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *please don t hesitate to message me on
